SENT.plain: The prevalence of atherosclerosis at the carotid bifurcation and in the siphon was reviewed in 141 patients who underwent 149 endarterectomies
The relationship between the presence and severity of siphon lesions and focal neurologic symptoms, both before and after operation, was also examined
Siphon disease was found in 84% of the 282 sides
Most lesions (42%) were in the 20% to 49% diameter-reduction category
Only 9% were stenoses greater than 50%, and 10% were occlusions
No relationship was found between the severity of disease at the carotid bifurcation and in the siphon
No pattern of siphon disease could be related to the occurrence of symptoms
Furthermore, no relation was found between the severity of siphon disease and recurrent symptoms after endarterectomy
